analysis: The documents primarily concern the implementation and modification of policies and regulations related to the National Industrial Recovery Act (NIRA) of 1933, along with some labor and economic matters during the Roosevelt and Clinton administrations. They cover a range of topics including fair competition codes, wage adjustments, labor disputes, and the establishment of committees and boards to address economic security and employment. Sentiment is generally neutral, focusing on the administrative and regulatory aspects of these policies.
title: NIRA Implementation and Labor-Economic Governance
